entries.title: AI-changelog web app completed and deployed
entries.whats_new: The web application now automatically summarizes changes from Git commits using AI technology. API is deployed on Railway and front-end on Vercel, with unnecessary code cleanup.
entries.breaking_change: The application now automatically summarizes changelog entries, which may change how users view and interpret commit history, but no specific breaking feature or API change was specified.
entries.impact: Users will experience a fully automated changelog summarization system, simplifying the process of understanding project updates.

entries.title: Enhanced summarization accuracy
entries.whats_new: Improved the accuracy of the AI model in summarizing breaking changes within commit messages.
entries.impact: More reliable identification and summarization of breaking changes, improving user trust and clarity in changelogs.

entries.title: Bug fixes on Git save method
entries.whats_new: Fixed bugs related to saving information to Git repositories and GitHub API interactions.
entries.impact: Reduced errors during Git operations, ensuring smoother and more reliable saving processes for users.

entries.title: Cache storage enhancements
entries.whats_new: Implemented caching of changelog data both locally and via GitHub API for faster access.
entries.impact: Speeds up changelog loading times and improves overall user experience.

entries.title: Configuration capabilities for users
entries.whats_new: Users can now configure their own Git repositories, OpenAI LLM settings, API keys, and other preferences.
entries.breaking_change: The system now supports user-specific configuration, potentially affecting how custom setups are managed and integrated.
entries.impact: Users gain more control and personalization of their changelog generation system, but need to manage their configuration settings carefully.

entries.title: Front-end interface enhancements
entries.whats_new: Improved the layout, added a loading effect, floating navbar, and detailed page navigation for changelog entries.
entries.breaking_change: When users click on a specific log entry, they are now taken directly to the detailed view of that entry.
entries.impact: Enhanced navigation and clarity in viewing changelog details, making it easier for users to access specific information.

entries.title: Changelog detail page feature
entries.whats_new: Users clicking on a specific entry now navigate to detailed logs, improving usability.
entries.breaking_change: Clicking on an entry redirects to a dedicated detail page rather than a simple list view.
entries.impact: Provides a more comprehensive and focused view of individual changelog entries for better understanding.

entries.title: API caching and layout update
entries.whats_new: Backend now generates a JSON cache file before loading changelog data; front-end layout paths updated to center and icons changed.
entries.breaking_change: Back-end API now produces a cache file before serving changelog data, which alters the data flow and may temporarily affect the loading process.
entries.impact: Improves performance and data management, leading to quicker load times and a more polished user interface.

entries.title: Basic front-end web interface
entries.whats_new: Initial user interface allowing viewing of GitHub changelog summaries generated automatically; layout includes sidebar and content sections.
entries.breaking_change: The front-end now supports viewing summaries generated from commit messages, changing from a purely manual or static display.
entries.impact: Provides users with a visual and accessible way to see project updates without manual parsing.
